pros: If you’re a right fit for the culture AND the industry, I really don’t think there’s a better company you can work for in the industry.
cons: It wasn’t a good fit for me long-term.

pros: I’ve been around the block a time or two, so here’s a review from somebody who actually knows what they’re talking about in the GRAND scheme of things: Runnymede is not the WORST or most AWFUL place to work or whatever other BS some of these other reviews are saying. It’s actually pretty great if you’re the right kind of person (ie someone who’s not an entitled, lazy millennial) There are a LOT of WORSE jobs out there, so go ahead… pass this one up… see what else you get and see how long that lasts. A job is a job. It’s never going to be perfect and you’re never going to LOVE it. If that were the case, it wouldn’t be a job. It’s a good healthcare center for the area and it’s doing its best.
cons: I’ve said everything I need to say.

pros: great work environment. The people who work there are friendly.
cons: staffing issues most of the time, and No opportunity for advancement for a Rehab assistant.

pros: I mean, obviously, there’s a lot more I like about working here than just the benefits, since I’ve been here for coming on 4 years, but if I had to choose one thing that was even better than all the rest, that would be the healthcare benefits. I have a sick little kid and having such good healthcare means the world to my family and I honesty don’t know what we’d do without it.
cons: I wouldn’t say no to a pay raise though.

pros: All considered, I would do it all over again in a heartbeat.
cons: It was a good experience and I don’t have any regrets.

pros: My colleagues go above and beyond for me. They’re so incredibly caring and supportive. I wouldn’t want to work anywhere else because I’d have to work without them.
cons: The work isn’t always easy. It requires a lot of patience.

pros: Everything so far has been a pro.
cons: There’s a five word minimum.

pros: The only answer you should give to getting a job offer here is yes!
cons: None. It’s a great company to work for.

pros: The staff there are really nice. I really appreciated how much everyone one was willing to pitch in and work together to get the work done. It made the work days go by much more quickly and productively.
cons: The work expectations were high day-to-day. I’m not sure how any of us would have managed if it wasn’t such a “all for one and one for all” kind of environment.

pros: All the pros are everything I listed in the title of this review.
cons: The only con was the workload expectations.

pros: For what it paid, it was worth it a hundred times over
cons: I made a ton of money in that year so can’t really say I have many complaints

pros: My experience at Runnymede Healthcare Centre was a good one. I can say from personal experience that they treat their administrative staff well and don’t take advantage of them just because we’re technically on the bottom of the corporate totem pole.
cons: I wanted more room to grow and work my way up and I just didn’t see that being a possibility anytime soon.

pros: The people I worked with were good people who were devoted to their jobs.
cons: I wanted more time off.

pros: The facility is nice. There’s a café on site and a gorgeous garden area you can eat lunch in.
cons: I took time off to have a baby and decided to become a stay at home mom.

review_title: Everyone is so friendly and welcoming
pros: Everyone has been so friendly and welcoming since I started on here. I haven’t had a single day yet where I felt like I couldn’t go to any one of my colleagues and ask for help or clarification.
cons: If there are any I haven’t noticed them yet.

review_title: It was great while I was there
pros: I wasn’t there for very long, but for the time I was there it was great.
cons: I had to leave due to a family emergency, nothing about the company.

pros: I found a decent work/life balance within the first year and it’s slowly gotten better as I’ve adjusted to the role and its responsibilities. It’s do-able, just takes some time and patience.
cons: So many people expect to be just handed a job that pays well without them actually having to do any work.

pros: It’s all pros! This place is great!
cons: There are no cons to working here at all!

pros: For the most part I would say I enjoyed working at Runnymede.
cons: I didn’t enjoy working with all of my coworkers.

pros: There’s a strong emphasis on team throughout the entire organization.
cons: The demands of the job were too much for someone like me with a newborn at home.

pros: Everything has been smooth sailing since I started over 2 years ago.
cons: I can’t think of a single thing.

pros: I can’t recommend this place enough! The people are so wonderful! And the pay is amazing! Just all around great!
cons: There aren’t any but I have to put 5 words here.

review_title: You can really make a lot working there!
pros: The money you can make while working there is almost unreal!
cons: You don’t get paid so much for nothing!

pros: The pay was better than I was expecting. I made enough to bulk up my savings quite a bit in only a year.
cons: You definitely sacrifice some free time to make more money.

pros: I’d recommend Runnymede to other nurses who are looking for work.
cons: Sometime the patients can be difficult

pros: Only good for overtime opportunity.
cons: upper management and CEO will throw people under the bus. Vacation is almost never approved

pros: Good team willing to work together for a positive outcome
cons: Management doesn’t back up employee despite excellent conduct. Senior leadership only listen to patients and their families

pros:
Absolutely Nothing!
But sadly, I need to enter at least 5 words in this section to submit this review.
cons:
This place is the epitome of corruption. It has literally set the benchmark as one of the most corrupt healthcare facilities in Ontario.
The place is a family-run, turn a blind eye and keep your mouth shut environment. The CEO's family are constantly promoted to higher positions for no reason other than nepotism. 

A toxic and disorganized mess with no morals or ethics. It's hard to fathom how such a disaster of an organization can continue operating. But then again, considering the crooked Ontario government in power (the worst administration in my lifetime) it's no surprise Runnymede continues to operate and evade consequences.

The morale there is so low. There are so many unhappy employees who only show up for a paycheque and have zero motivation.

My advice to job seekers: Avoid this place at all costs, even of you think the pay is good. Trust me, no amount of pay can make up for the misery and anxiety of working under terrible conditions and constantly worrying about your job.

pros: good benefit as compared to other hospital
cons: fast paced environment as compare to other hospitals

review_title: Terrible CEO - source of low employee retention and poor work environment
pros: Employees, Cafeteria Prices, Location, Industry
cons:
Get rid of the CEO. Her sense of entitlement and mean-spiritedness is hurtinConnie Dejak is a terrible professional, and human being. You can tell she has been at the helm of this place for far too long, and this sense of entitlement is hurting the work-culture at Runnymede Healthcare Centre. She shows little empathy, patience or grace as a human being when interacting with employees in any professional situation.

Her management style is erratic, mean-spirited, and it tanslates through to every department at the hospital. Good, honest, professional people are hired and work there, but her presence taints what should be a good, beneficial work environment. A change in the CEO would most certainly improve any and all employee experience, and ultimately retention.

CEOs or leaders get unfairly blamed a lot for creating terrible and unwelcome work environments, but dig not so deep at Runnymede Healthcare Centre and you'll quickly find out that Connie Dejak is the source of the problem.

review_title: Great place to work very friendly staff and management
pros: Very advanced Healthcare facility delivering a high level of patient care.
cons: Extremely fast pace environment, you need to be organized and committed in order to be successful.

pros: Co worker are Nice and Friendly
cons: Very bad management. They can fire you on the spot

review_title: Stable office job but not for everyone
pros:
-Consistent hours
-Nice coworkers
-Accessible to transit
-large office space
-co-workers always willing to help
cons:
-Large work overload comparing to staff
-old work systems that doesnt optimize/ehance productivity
-really boring and repetitive work, this is not the job for you if you value creativity and challenging yourself

pros: The organizational policies are well structured.
cons: They have poor employees recognition.

pros:
Great co-workers 
Good learning environment 
Wonderful team support
cons:
Shift timing takes up the entire day
Staffing issues
Workload

pros: Paid well and co workers were friendly
cons: Upper management slow to make vital decisions. Scheduling department is terrible

pros: Fantastic nursing staff, always willing and ready to help.
cons: Management sucks, its a family affair.

pros: Great work environment.  Great teamwork.
cons: Hard to change your shift.

pros: Great staff  to work with
cons: Pay not refective of education
